Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Continually \Con*tin"u*al*ly\, adv. 1. Without cessation; unceasingly; continuously; as, the current flows continually. [1913 Webster]
Why do not all animals continually increase in bigness? --Bentley. [1913 Webster]
2. In regular or repeated succession; very often. [1913 Webster]
Thou shalt eat bread at my table continually. --2 Sam. ix. 7. [1913 Webster]
continually adv : seemingly without interruption; "complained continually that there wasn't enough money"
